page.title: 03Washing Up
page.content: We{wash up}by putting the{dirty dishes in the{sink.}The{sink}is a{square tub with a hole in the bottom that has lots of little holes in it; it is called a{plughole.}It also has another square hole at the back, so if you put too much{water}in the{sink}it will flood out of the hole. On the top of the sink are{taps}that let water into the sink, one is for hot water and one is for cold. You put the{plug}in the {plughole.}The{plug}is a piece of {rubber}connected to a{chain,}it is the same size and shape as the{plughole and fits in perfectly. Then you turn the hot and cold water{taps}and you get warm water. As you are doing this you put in the{washing up liquid, which is a combination of different {chemicals}that makes the water bubbley. You{wash up}and{drain everything. By Maria O'Donnell
